title: 2-300ms+ ping once in a while
body:
Normally, I get about 50-60ms ping in-game after the big move to the Chicago servers (RIP me, I lived about 30 minutes from Portland, OR). However, I've notice that once in a while I end up in a game where I've had insane ping. Usually it's about ~250ms, but this ARAM game i just had was the worst. I can't predict the issue, it just seems to happen once every dozen games or so.

I tried Alt-F4ing to the desktop, restarting my computer, and logging back into League, but I was still getting about the same ping. Needless to say, it was extremely noticeable and made playing rather difficult this match. Timing shields and stuns correctly on Morgana was next to impossible with such a delay; I was basically guessing. 

I may not be that great of a player, but I would hate for this to happen in a ranked game. Not only for my own ranking, but because I would be a liability for my team due to issues outside of my control. I wasn't able to fix it for that game, but the following game, I had my typical ~60ms. Am I just getting randomly routed to the EU servers or something?

{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

replies.body:
I'm sorry that you're having random ping spikes -- I know there's nothing more annoying than a connection going haywire in the middle of the match. Do you have the net logs for that game handy?

If you're not sure how to find them:

Windows: look in C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Logs\Network Logs

Mac: open a Finder window, press ⌘-Shift-G, and paste in
/Applications/League of Legends.app/Contents/LOL/Logs/Network Logs

It'll be dated, so you can find the one where your connection was very poor.

Also, do you tend to play on a wireless or wired connection? If wireless, can you let me know the model of your router so I can get some more info there and help troubleshoot any possible home network issues you're having?

I do have those logs. I play on a wired connection with a modem/router (ZyXEL PK5001Z), but at the time there wasn't any other active connections. I made sure torrents, steam, my phone, etc. weren't taking up any bandwidth.

Here is the game in question.
Before restart - http://pastebin.com/eYhE5LtL 
After restart - http://pastebin.com/Tbue9ac8

And just for comparison, here are the logs from games before and after that one.
Before: http://pastebin.com/6aN62qmY
After: http://pastebin.com/wZbiNnHP

Thanks for that! It looks like you have a baseline of a few packets lost each time the log fires, and that is definitely a lot more noticeable in those high ping games.

Could you do a traceroute for me to the NA servers?

Press the Win + R
Type cmd in the search bar and click "Ok". You should now see a black window with white letters.
Highlight and copy the following:
(tracert 104.160.131.1) > "%USERPROFILE%\desktop\Tracert.txt"
Right click in the command prompt you opened and click "Paste" (ctrl+V won't work)

Once that runs, can you throw tracert.txt from your desktop into a pastebin as well?

That traceroute looks nice and healthy, so I'm assuming your connection is good currently. Next time this is happening in the moment, can you pull another traceroute and upload it? That'll help quite a bit with understanding what is going wrong with the connection at the time. For now, since your connection is looking much better, just have fun out there and be sure to run a traceroute if it happens again :)

Hey Koya,

Sorry for the delay in getting back to you.

There are some known issues with WOW! ISP and League of Legends right now. Check out the boards post here for more info: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/guN7X7k4-220ms-ping-issues-on-wow-internet

Thanks for sending your traceroutes!

Hi! I live in Venezuela, I normally have Ping of 80-300 I can deal with it, but some times it spikes up to 2000, 2500, 3k, once it reached over 6k, once it was on 14k!

What can I do about it? Besides killing Maduro (our president) 

Some times I think I could finnaly get to Diamond if I got a decent connection, I even stopped playing Skillshot champs (Xerath was my main, now it is Quinn), because it is too hard to land them decently if I am lagged, and it is sad for me, I was between the best 1000 Xeraths in S4.

Leus LAN

> [{quoted}](name=Cherysse,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Hg2XA5nE,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-02-23T21:51:48.328+0000)
>

> 
> Leus LAN

I have this exact same problem, except I'm in California. I think the problem is the internet provider. I've used Ethernet and (currently using)Wi-Fi, and they both give similar results. I have Time Warner Cable, and I was going to switch to someone else soon. If you do some research, you could probably find the best ISP for your area. http://www.speedtest.net/awards <--- You can check here.

Then again, not to be pessimistic, but most big name companies that have really fast internet operate in NA and EU. If you're using Ethernet, and you have the best router you can get, with the best service provider, I don't think there's anything else you could do after that.

I know you are trying to be possitive xD and thanks for the help, but actually Im just joking, currently Venezuela (hello here) is under a dictatorship and everything is f-ckd up so hard that if I tell you, you just wouldn't believe me.

> [{quoted}](name=MarshmallowBob,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Hg2XA5nE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-02-23T18:50:32.715+0000)

For now, since your connection is looking much better, just have fun out there and be sure to run a traceroute if it happens again :)

So, I just had it happen again. Unfortunately, it happened in a rank game, and was close to 500-600ms ping constantly.

http://imgur.com/9vPtdcn

tracert log: http://pastebin.com/spYnCQWw

network log (both before and after restart):  http://pastebin.com/RNreLAF8

Of course, I immediately jump into a bot game right after, and I'm back down to my usual ping. The game I played beforehand, everything was a-okay as well. Absolutely aggravating, and I'm sure I got reported, because I attempted to restart both computer and modem to make sure it wasn't me. The problem is, I have no idea there is a problem until the loading screen, which by then it's too late!

I just lost a ranked game I was winning all game because of this. Won every teamfight, could 1v1 anyone on their team, then the last 10 minutes of the game I get constant 3-500 ping spikes and end up losing because I lag and die immediately. What a great game.
